docs.lead_paragraph: An extreme ballot measure in Mississippi, which would define a fertilized human egg as a “person,” would destroy women’s reproductive rights.
docs.abstract: Editorial contends extreme ballot measure in Mississippi, which would define a fertilized human egg as a 'person,' would destroy women’s reproductive rights; argues besides outlawing abortions, with no exceptions for rape, incest or when a woman's life is in danger, measure carries serious implications, including creating a legal quagmire.
docs.snippet: An extreme ballot measure in Mississippi, which would define a fertilized human egg as a “person,” would destroy women’s reproductive rights.

headline.main: Think Like a Doctor: The Right Test Solved!

docs.abstract: On Wednesday, we challenged Well readers to really think like a doctor. We asked you to figure out the diagnosis for a complicated patient and to design the testing strategy necessary to reach that diagnosis; to do, in short, what every doctor has to do in order to make a diagnosis.

docs.lead_paragraph: Two female singers, unknown to each other, Falguni Shah and Emel Aykanat, are using Oriental instruments and rhythms to speak out against racism and try to overcome prejudices.
docs.snippet: Two female singers, unknown to each other, Falguni Shah and Emel Aykanat, are using Oriental instruments and rhythms to speak out against racism and try to overcome prejudices.

headline.main: I.V.F. Without the Risk of Multiple Births?

docs.abstract: A new study showed success in implanting one embryo, rather than two or more.
docs.snippet: A new study showed success in implanting one embryo, rather than two or more.

docs.lead_paragraph: A few years ago, a friend, who, like many of our peers, got started late in the baby game and ended up going the  in vitro fertilization route, told me she was pregnant with twins. They'd used two embryos to maximize the chance of getting pregnant, and both had taken. But they didn't want twins. The next time I saw her, she had one baby.

headline.main: I.V.F. Without the Risk of Multiple Births?

headline.main: Think Like a Doctor: Ordering the Right Test

docs.abstract: What test needs to be ordered to help reach a diagnosis for a young woman with chronic pain that has lasted for a decade?
